boardgame.name: Archers of Nand
boardgame.description:
The Valley of Nand is being overrun by wild hordes of orcs. While the local warriors are losing the hand-to-hand battle, the archers of Nand are taking advantage of the height of their mountains to decimate the enemy troops. In this game, you'll have to decide how to protect the valley through the combined action of the warriors and archers of Nand before the orcs destroy everything!

Archers of Nand is recommended for ages 10 and up, 1 to 2 players, and games of 20 minutes.

Playing this game you will learn the basics of computer databases (the Nand Valley represents a small data TABLE where you will SELECT its regions to attack the orcs).

—description from the publisher

Compatible with X-Wing and legal during official tournaments. A great way to upgrade your X-Wing collection with high quality plexiglass tokens. Sets are created to match various requirements of X-Wing fans and to make the gaming experience even better.

The Upgraded Set provides tokens with better, higher quality and more colourful overprint.They are more diverse now and they attract attention easier, it’s also easier to notice them on the table.

boardgame.name: Dark Dungeons X
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Dungeons, the retro-roleplaying game in the style of old-school 1980’s and 1990’s role-playing when rogues were thieves, races were classes, and you could start your adventuring careed exploring a few basic dungeons and end up travelling the planes as a being of pure divine power is back for a tenth anniversary edition!

This new edition is the entire game in a single book, so there is no need to cross- reference between multiple rule books and supplements, and it contains all the rules from both Dark Dungeons and Darker Dungeons, as well as extensive developer commentary explaining which rules were kept from the source material and which were changed (and why).

boardgame.name: Conan the Adventurer
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

WELCOME TO THE SOUTHERN KINGDOMS

“THERE ARE HALF A DOZEN POWERFUL FACTIONS PLOTTING AND INTRIGUING AGAINST EACH OTHER — THERE ARE CONTINUAL BRAWLS IN THE TAVERNS AND STREETS, SECRET MURDERS, MUTILATIONS, AND EXECUTIONS. AND THERE ARE WOMEN, GOLD, WINE — ALL THAT A MERCENARY WANTS!”

Conan the Adventurer is the definitive guide to the lands south of the Styx River, including serpent-haunted Stygia, Kush, Darfar, Keshan, Punt, Zembabwei, and that vast region known to the folk of the Dreaming West as “the Black Kingdoms”.

Rife with mystery and ancient, long forgotten cultures and ruins, this region is brimming with potential for adventure and intrigue.

New archetypes like the Adventurer, Griot, Tomb Guardian, and Witch-finder, including talents, war stories, educations, equipment, and other background elements to bring them to life.
Cultural groups such as the Chagas and Gallahs of Shumballa, the dreaming folk of Xuthal, the Aphakis of Tombalku, the Ghanata tribe, and the strange denizens of isolated Xuchotl.
Important characters high and low: King Ctesphon of Stygia, Ageera the Witch-finder, Tananda of Shumballa, the sorcerer Tuthmes, Thalis of Xuthal, Amalric, King Sakumbe of Tombalku, King Zehbeh of the Aphaki, Gorulga of Kheshan, the roguish Stygian adventurer Thutmekri, and others.
Stunning art and maps produced by a variety of new and renowned Conan artists.
A guide to the countries of Stygia, Kush, Darfar, Keshan, Punt, Tombalku, Zembabwei, and the other Black Kingdoms, describing their histories and their cultures, and cities lost to human ken.
Conan described during his period as a war-chief in the Black Kingdoms.
Terrifying beasts and monsters: giant scorpions; the pig devil; the Crawler in the Dark; the immortal vampire queen Akivasha; and the and the dreaded Ollam-onga and its devil riders.
Myths and magic, such as the infamous cabal of sorcerers called the Black Ring, timeless Ghazal, the lost women of the flowery vale, the cults of Ajujo and Jhil, and more.
Developed with leading Conan scholars, this is the place for exotic Hyborian Age adventure, just as Howard created it!
boardgame.rpg: Robert E. Howard's Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of

6 exciting game modes for you to try out

—description from the publisher

В этой коробке полтысячи нарисованных человечков и пять весёлых игр на скорость и внимательность для разных возрастов. Сможете ли вы отыскать нужного человечка раньше всех? Самые быстрые получат в награду пирожок!

Подходит для детей от 4 лет.
500 уникальных рисунков человечков.

—description from the publisher (Russian)

boardgame.name: Trilemma Adventures Compendium Bestiary (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains more than 100 monsters from the award-winning Trilemma Adventures series, with stats for the fifth edition of your favorite roleplaying game. Inside are:

beasts of the wood
alien aberrations
people of the underworld
celestial horrors
demonic incursions
ghostly remnants of ages past


..and scores of other entries to surprise your players and enrich your campaign. Use them along with the Compendium, or in adventures of your own design.

boardgame.name: Pandora Cat
パンドラの猫
boardgame.description:
In Pandora Cat, a.k.a. パンドラの猫, you're racing to reach a points threshold before any other player can, but in each round you never know whether you want to score high or low until it's almost over.

Each round, each player is dealt four cards from the 24-card deck. Each of the eight types of cards has a value on it as well as a special ability. Each player chooses one card from their hand, then they reveal these cards in clockwise order from the starting player. Players then do this again two more times, leaving them with one card in hand.

Your score for the round is the sum of the value of the card in your hand and the value of the cards you played. Normally the player with the highest score earns 5 points, with the players in second and third earning 3 and 1 points respectively — but if a player has played two "Pandora Cat" cards, then the player with the lowest score earns 5 points! If two players have each played two "Pandora Cat" cards, then scoring is normal, whereas three players having done this reverses the score once again.

Rotate the start player position each round, and complete multiple rounds until a player has scored at least 12, 14, or 16 points in a three-player, four-player, or five- or six-player game.

boardgame.name: Starlight Inheritors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Glory and Ruin Amongst the Stars!
When Vandara was imprisoned, it left behind a wide variety of colonies, technologies, and peoples across the Aurin system. These forces have adapted since the Sundering, ushering in a new age of conflict and espionage across a war-ruined solar system. Discover the secrets of five scattered planets and the many moons that surround them! Gear up with over 30 new talents from the Technomancy Sphere (now with Wild Magic) and the brand-new high-octane Pilot Sphere (complete with Advanced Talents, Drawbacks, and new options for the Conscript and Prodigy classes)! Explore new facets of combat with 8 new archetypes and a variety of new high-tech mechanics, from the far-seeing Cosmic Prophet to the ever-resourceful Elite Commando to the endlessly versatile Gearmaster! In Aurin, the future belongs to those who claim it. Are you brave enough to take your place among them?

Spheres Left Behind is the eighth amazing installment in the ever-growing Arcforge Campaign Setting, providing a wealth of lore for Starfinder Roleplaying Game and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GMs and players alike. Players get 10 new archetypes and class options, plus over 70 new class features, feats, abilities, and other enhancements, including material specially designed to function with Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might from Drop Dead Studios. GMs get entirely new worlds, even more expanded material and errata, plus over 150 technomantic wild magic effects, item glitches, and more! No matter what your flavor of sci-fi, you’ll find an amazing array of awesome stuff in these pages!

boardgame.name: Dreams of Typhon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the Infamous Typhon Station, Death Isn't the End

Dreams of Typhon is a mini-setting by BPB Games, the creators of Savage Tokusatsu and StarStreamers, that captures the terrifying dread of sci-fi horror and the optimistic hopelessness of Soulslike video games in one condensed document. Take on the role of accursed survivors caught within the inescapable walls of the titular Typhon Station. Always a place for outcasts and true criminals, Typhon Station met four simultanious apocalypses that, somehow, created a delicate way for mere mortals to survive on the station. However, something foul corrupts the area and many who die simply return to life at a nearby location. Though they still have keen recollections of their surely grisly demises, many survivors continue to fight to live on.

What's in Dreams of Typhon?

Descriptions for the Four Major and Four Minor Threats that menace the derelict station
5 Organizations that existed on Typhon before its collapse
11 NEW pieces of Weapons and Armor
6 Pregenerated Characters
2 New Setting Rules to capture the Soulslike feeling of dying over and over
1 Short Adventure to introduce players to Typhon Station's dangers
A selection or 10 New Monsters to hunt down and slaughter survivors




Content Warnings

Dreams of Typhon is a horror setting that utilizes several instances of Body Horror and one instance of a fungal Parasytic Infestation.

boardgame.name: Wieczna Waśń
boardgame.description:
Wieczna Waśń ("Eternal Feud") is a strategic board game from 2 to 4 people / 8 + / 60-120 depending on the map of the land, in which 4 feuded races fight for dominance in a randomly created land.

No one remembers how the feud began, who came to the field or who first chewed on the stone ... the fact is that this feud seems to have always happened. People against the green horde of orcs from the north ... until one day the conflict joined the fallen, a great army of the dead rose up and went to war with the living ... in this eternal feud.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Forest of Radgost
boardgame.description:
Detailed miniatures, immersive storytelling, and rich mythology await you in Forest of Radgost, a cooperative storytelling tabletop game that brings Slavic mythology to life.

When a boy and a girl disappear from their village somewhere in IX century Europe, the village druid dispatches a search party to find the children and escort them back to safety. As one of the members of that search party, you will need to trespass into the sacred forest and cross the boundary that separates the realm of humans from the realm of the Slavic deity Radgost.

Inhabiting the forest are strange beings such as the Psoglav, Lesnik, or Todorci, none of which take kindly to human intruders.

You'll need to use all your skills, wisdom, and instincts to survive the numerous encounters with these strange creatures.

Along the way you will develop your character, collect items, gain skills, separate and rejoin with other members of the search party, and, possibly, discover the secret reason why the druid chose you to join the search party.

Forest of Radgost is a role-playing game where each player controls a character with a fleshed-out backstory, motivation, and skill-set. Players navigate the web of interconnected forest footpaths with a pair of dice that determine the distance and direction of their movement, evoking the feeling of being lost in the woods, with creatures lurking at each crossroad.

At each encounter, players must decide whether to run, hide, flee, or communicate, without knowing which creature they are about to face. Depending on their choices, the encounters are resolved according to the numerous scenarios provided in the accompanying book of encounters.

Nine decks of cards add an open-world dimension, allowing players to explore the rich game world based on four years of research into Slavic mythology. Numerous scenarios, map details, and cards interact to weave a unique storyline ensuring that players will never have the same adventure twice.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Delve! Zine (Issue 3 - New Zealand Autumn 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delve! Zine is back! All hail the triumphant return of Delve! Zine with the heroic third issue. Journey to the lands of the Mystic East and pick one of four warrior classes to include in your old school style fantasy role playing game. Based upon a Swords and Wizardry foundation, presented here are the Barbarian nomad, the Kensei, ninja, and samurai classes. Weapons and armour are included to equip your adventurers. Raise your sake glass in toast to adventure!

boardgame.name: Adventure, Inc.
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World's Greatest Heroes... Are Looking for Replacements!

Imagine a new hero recruited to join the training program of the greatest group of heroes the world has ever known. What excitement! What thrills! What... overwhelming pressure! But even the greatest heroes can't fight the good fight forever, and the time to pass the baton comes sooner or later. That time is now, and that hero is yours.

Adventure, Inc. is all about this type of campaign. As a supplement for the Tiny Legacies imprint, which is itself a series of sourcebooks for the Tiny Supers Role-Playing Game published by Gallant Knight Games, it delves into how to take this idea and make it your own. Through fiction, it examines the concepts of recruitment and how to incorporate wildly different heroes into the same campaign. The campaign framework at the end discusses how to structure such a campaign and offers an entirely new mechanic: Team Traits!

The world needs heroes. Are you up for the job?

boardgame.name: Dungeon Bounty
boardgame.description:
"The once profitable mines of Altair have become overrun with the most sinister of beasts. Miners, knights, and sell-swords have all fallen at the claws of these foul creatures. With the Kingdom of Yule already on the verge of bankruptcy, the King cannot afford to lose control of these mines. No amount of death can stop his desire to retain his power.Lucky for you, your reputation as a Bounty Hunter has earned you a chance to prove your worth. Capturing criminals has been easy, surely your unique skill set will transfer to killing beasts. The King is willing to empty the last of the kingdom's coffers for the heads of these creatures. Will you fall amongst the treasure and corpses of the cavern or slay your enemies to claim your due glory?"

Dungeon Bounty is a fast paced hand management game designed to be played with a single standard deck of playing cards. On each turn, players flip two cards from the deck (dungeon). If the cards are a 1-10 of clubs (weapons), diamonds (gemstones), or spades (spells), the player chooses one to add to their play area. Face cards (Jacks, Queens, and Kings) are the bounties, the creatures you are hunting, and when they pop up as one of the two drawn cards from the dungeon, you need to defeat them using your attack power from weapons and spells. The more bounties you collect, the higher your score.

If you are unable to defeat a monster, they do damage to you, reducing your strength, which is represented by the 1-10 of hearts. If you are at 1 strength and are damaged by an enemy, you lose. If you manage to stay alive, the game ends after two trips through the dungeon. After you've depleted the deck the first time, you shuffle the discard pile and play through the deck a second time. Compare your score to the scoring guide and see your destiny.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Small World of Warcraft
小小魔兽世界
스몰 월드 오브 워크래프트
boardgame.description:
In Small World of Warcraft, players vie for conquest and control of a world that is simply too small to accommodate everybody.

Small World of Warcraft is set on the fantasy world of Azeroth, where the races of the Alliance and the Horde — including Orcs, Dwarves, Trolls, and Worgen — clash in a world-consuming conflict. In the game, players choose combinations of special powers and races from the Warcraft universe, such as Portal Mage Pandarens or Herbalist Goblins, and vie for control of Azeroth. To help them achieve dominance, players will occupy legendary terrains and seek control of powerful artifacts. However, all empires must eventually fall, so players need to be ready to put an overextended race into a state of "decline" and lead a new one to rule Azeroth.

In more detail, on each turn either you use the multiple tiles of your chosen fantasy race to (normally) occupy adjacent territories, possibly defeating weaker enemy races along the way, or you give up on your race and let it go into decline. A race in decline is designated by flipping the tiles over to their black-and-white side. At the start of the game or after you go into decline, you choose a new race/power combination at the start of your turn, with the 16 races and 20 powers being paired randomly each game.

At the end of your turn, you score one coin for each territory your races occupy. You may have one active race and one race in decline on the board at the same time. Your occupation total can vary depending on the special abilities of your race and the territories they occupy. After the final round, the player with the most coins wins.

boardgame.name: Cruel Seas: AB-Tei Gunboat
boardgame.description:
The Imperial Japanese Army started developing small gunboats for close support of amphibious landings in 1924 and by 1927 had the AB-Tei gunboat. By WWII these would be diesel-powered. They would be transported to the landing zones on merchant ships. They were also used as patrol boats in rivers, harbors and coastal zones and to escort supply barges. In this role they encountered PT boats.

The ‘57 mm’ guns were actually the Japanese Type 97 47 mm anti-tank gun or a British 6 pdr. Contains 4 gunboats and state cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Abstract
boardgame.description:
Abstract - a paint by number game

Overview: You are a talented artist who specializes in abstract art. Paint/Roll your way to the next masterpiece!
Players: 1 - 100+
Game Time: 20 minutes
Items needed: 5 six-sided dice
Optional - Markers/Crayons/Pencils of the 6 colors to make your work of art beautiful (Purple, Blue, Green, Yellow, Orange, and Red)

Setup: Determine the End Goals for this game. Roll a die for each of the three end goals (A, B, C). These three goals are how to earn points from your painting, the other goals that were not rolled are ignored for this game.

The game is played over 12 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, assigning however each player determines.

Gameplay: Each Round you will Roll 5 dice and then use the dice to mark two numbers on your painting and also gain a bonus. From the 5 dice, two of those dice will be used to place a number on your painting, then another two dice will be used to place another number on your painting, and the 5th die will be used to gain the corresponding bonus. These markings can be done in any order.

- Roll 5 dice - Roll the 5 dice. Write the numbers in the top right corner on the current round’s track. This is just used as a helpful reference.

- Use dice for painting two numbers and gaining a bonus
In any order, do these three actions without using the same die more than once:

Paint a number in a square - use two dice, one for the placement location and the other for the number/paint color used.
Example: You choose a die with a 1 and a die with a 3. You use the 1 for the placement location, so the number placed will need to be in one of the unused squares in the “1” grid. You choose the 3 as the number/paint color used in that square. You write a 3 in one of the open squares in the 1 grid.
If you there are no available squares in a die’s location, you may not choose that.

Paint a number in a square - Do this again, same as above. You must use dice that have not been used.

Gain a Bonus - use a die to gain one of the three bonuses. Use a 1 or 2 to gain a “+/- 1” to use now or later, use a 3 or 4 to gain a “place anywhere” to use now or later, and use a 5 or 6 to gain a Star. Each star is worth 1 point at the end of the game and gives no other bonus.

Reminder: you can do these three actions in any order. There are times when gaining the bonus first allows you to paint a more helpful square for your painting.

Repeat this each round (rolling 5 dice and using those 5 dice) until 12 rounds have been completed.

Important Note: If you ever cannot place one of your numbers on your painting, mark an X anywhere you choose in a square on your painting. Each X’ed space on your painting is negative 1 point at the end of the game.

Using your Bonuses: You may use your bonuses at any time during the game. When you gain a bonus, circle it. When used, cross it off to show it has been used. You may spend multiple bonuses in the same round. As your painting fills up, it becomes more difficult to place your numbers. It can be especially helpful to save some bonuses to use in the last rounds of the game.

Using +/- 1 Dice Bonus: When used, you may increase or decrease one of the dice numerically by one. This can be used to change a die to help with placing the die, the number/color of the die, or for gaining a bonus.

Using Place Anywhere Bonus: When used, you may use one of your dice to place the number of another die anywhere.
Example: You have a 1 and a 3 for placement and number/color. All of your squares are filled in your “1 grid” and your “3 grid”. You spend a Place Anywhere bonus to change your 1 die to a Place Anywhere. You then choose to place the number/color 3 in the 5 grid, where it is advantageous for your end goals and where there is also an available square.

Star Bonus: Each star is worth 1 point at the end of the game and gives no other bonus. You’re a star!

Each End Goal Explained:
End Goal A: Earn points for matching shapes of the same number/color. The orientation of the shape can be mirrored and/or flipped in any way, as long as it is the same shape. You cannot use the same number twice for shapes. You can use these numbers for B and C end goals
End Goal B: Earn points for each pair of these numbers anywhere on your painting. These two numbers do not need to be connected. Example: You have placed three 1’s and five 2’s in your painting. You have three pairs (set of 1&2, 1&2, and 1&2), so you earn 6 points; 2 per pair.
End Goal C: This goal is looking at unique numbers in either rows, columns, or grids. If you fulfill this goal in multiple rows/columns/grids, you score each time it is fulfilled.

End of Game:
After you have completed the 12th roll/round, total your points earned from each End Goal, one point for each Star bonus, and subtract one point for each X on your painting (unpainted squares). The player with the most points is the winner!

Look at your amazing masterpiece and name it and autograph it.

For those who want to take it to the next level: When marking numbers, you can use coordinating colors (color key in top left of page). After finishing, you can fill in the boxes completely with the corresponding colors to beautify your work of art.

-description from designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Amnesie
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sechs Charaktere wachen zu Beginn des Szenarios auf, ohne dass sie sich daran erinnern können, wer sie sind oder wo sie sich befinden. Lediglich eine leichte Ahnung beschleicht sie, was für eine Persönlichkeit in ihnen steckt. Klingt abgedroschen? Dann überrascht Amnesie vielleicht umso mehr und sorgt für eine schnell eskalierende Achterbahnfahrt, während die Erinnerung Stück für Stück zurückkommt.

Dies ist das Spielmaterial zum Szenario:

Charakterbögen
Flurpläne
Handouts



Translation courtesy of Google:

Six characters wake up at the beginning of the scenario without being able to remember who they are or where they are. She only has a slight idea what kind of personality she has. Sounds trite? Then perhaps amnesia is even more surprising and ensures a rapidly escalating roller coaster ride, while the memory comes back piece by piece.

This is the game material for the scenario:

Character sheets
Floor plans
Handouts

boardgame.name: Der Tod in Venedig
boardgame.description:
From backcover of the german pdf/print

Venedig im Herbst 1956. Ein Schriftsteller mit Schreibblockade, eine gescheiterte Opernsängerin, ein verschwundenes Kind. Und schon bald steigt in der italienischen Lagunenstadt ein schrecklicher Verdacht auf, drohend wie der Nebel aus den Kanälen.

Der Tod in Venedig ist ein Kammerspiel in zwölf Akten für zwei Spielerinnen, die sich auf eine Reise nach Italien begeben – und zu den Abgründen der menschlichen Gier.

Dies ist das Spielmaterial zum Szenario:

Charakterbögen
Handouts



Translation courtesy of Google:

Venice in autumn 1956. A writer with a writer's block, a failed opera singer, a missing child. And soon a terrible suspicion arises in the Italian lagoon city, looming like the fog from the canals.

Death in Venice is a chamber game in twelve acts for two players who are going on a trip to Italy - and to the abysses of human greed.

This is the game material for the scenario:

Character sheets
Handouts

boardgame.name: Die Außenseiter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In diesem Einführungsszenario schlüpfen die Spielerinnen in die Rolle von Angestellten eines großen Bauunternehmens und müssen sich in den Bergen von Neuengland mit verschrobenen Einheimischen, konkurrierenden Parteien sowie dunklen Geheimnissen auseinandersetzen. Es sind fünf vorgefertigte Spielercharaktere vorhanden, die direkt zum Losspielen einladen.

Dies ist das Spielmaterial zum Szenario:

Charakterbögen



Translation courtesy of Google:

In this introductory scenario, the players take on the roles of employees of a large construction company and have to deal with cranky locals, competing parties and dark secrets in the mountains of New England. There are five ready-made player characters that invite you to start playing.

This is the game material for the scenario:

Character sheets

boardgame.name: Mens sana
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rhodos im Juli 1480: Fünf Personen befinden sich inmitten der Wirren eines Großangriffs durch die osmanische Seestreitmacht. Schon zu Beginn werden sie schwer verletzt und stecken im Dilemma zwischen Verpflichtungen und Genesung fest. Körperlich bis an ihre Grenzen gebracht, warten jedoch auch verschiedene Konflikte auf sie und es wird zunehmend undeutlicher, wer Freund und wer Feind ist. Und was den Unterschied zwischen Sieg und Niederlage ausmachen könnte.
Mens sana ist ein Kammerspiel in einer belagerten Stadt und gibt den Spielerinnen die Gelegenheit zu ausgiebigem Charakterspiel und dem Ausloten der eigenen Handlungsweisen inmitten moralischer Konflikte.

Dies ist das Spielmaterial zum Szenario:

10-seitiges Begleitheft zum Orden vom Hospital des Heiligen Johannes zu Jerusalem
Charakterbögen
Handouts
Mindmaps



Translation courtesy of Google:

Rhodes in July 1480: Five people are in the midst of the turmoil of a major attack by the Ottoman naval force. They are seriously injured right from the start and are stuck in the dilemma between obligations and recovery. Physically pushed to their limits, however, various conflicts await them and it becomes increasingly unclear who is friend and who is enemy. And what could make the difference between winning and losing.
Mens sana is a chamber game in a besieged city and gives the players the opportunity to play extensively in character and explore their own actions in the midst of moral conflicts.

This is the game material for the scenario:

10-page booklet accompanying the Order of the Hospital of St. John in Jerusalem
Character sheets
Handouts
Mind maps

boardgame.name: Bordeaux by Night: Players Guide (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new, revised layout version of best selling master project Bordeaux by Night is now available!

This new layout fixes some accessibility issues, including when it comes to reading the maps and the coterie charts (now fully PDF-friendly and not image). A new proper disclaimer alongside a special "No Fascists" rule has been added for clarity.New art has been added with links to the artists' medias for you to be able to commission your own. These include VtM long time fans such as Bella Bergolts and Edouard Noisette. Chris "Mr Gone" Leland's character sheet was also included. Audio files of myself pronouncing the names of the NPCs has been added as well (with some variants offered), for your entertainement.

This book overall is edition neutral, but its lore is closer to Revised era books (Such as the Gangrel leaving the Camarilla...) while its feel and ambiance is 1st or 2nd edition (behind closed doors personal and political horror). This book contains everything that is publicly known, common knowledge by locals. The secrets are in the Storytellers Guide.

Blood and wine come in many flavors

Known for its wine and architecture, Bordeaux hides many facets in its cellars. Open this player guide for Bordeaux and read about the city that was English due to a 12th century divorce and marriage, a city that traded metals and slaves, a city with high technology and world-renowned institutes, a city of patrimony, collaborators and resistants, of the precursors of the Enlightenment ideas and of fierce rivalries with Paris. And the biggest European sand dune.

Bordeaux by Night includes:

An overview of the general and local history and geography;
Maps and other visual aids;
A small crash course on Just French Things;
What is known about notable characters and their coterie charts;
References and further sources;
And a special Mr Gone character sheet!

boardgame.name: The Gates of Damascus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thunder in the East

Since the time of the Second City, the Children of Haqim have been the judges of the Children of Caine. Yet times are changing and, in recent years, many of the Banu Haqim who arrive in the Levant are harsh and uncompromising, wanting to impose their own ideas of order upon the Cainites of the land. Regardless of the reasons for the rise of this new breed amongst the clan, their appearance is seen by many Syrian Cainites as an ominous sign. There are some who claim to have heard the thunder in the east, warning of an approaching storm.

Syria by Night

The Gates of Damascus is a location sourcebook for Vampire: the Dark Ages, focused on Syria. The book contains general information on the region, as well as chapters on two key domains, the cities of Raqqa and Amman, providing information on the history, geography, and Cainite populations of these places.

boardgame.name: By Banner Bound
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

By Banner Bound takes a look at nobility from several angles. Inspired by banner houses as presented in the Changeling Players Guide it also asks, if someone is exiling houses to the autumn realm, who is that someone. Also, the idea of older courts was hinted at in the Changeling the Dreaming 20th anniversary edition core book that is expanded upon and given to the Thallian of the Sidhe, answering: what happens to the abandoned dreams of the children of the Tuatha.

By Banner Bound contains:
• 13 Banner houses for each of the Autumn houses
• Ancient Arcadian houses based on the Weaver, Wyld, and Wyrm
• The Sevartal Clans based on the abandoned seasonal courts
• House specific treasures and
• Convoke, an Art thought lost to the mists.

boardgame.name: Gifted & Talented
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally run on the Onyx Path Twitch in Fall 2019, now you can run this short Changeling: the Dreaming chronicle for your own troupe!

Budget cuts loom, and with them the prospect of cutting Ivywild High School's extracurricular programs. This is bad enough, but one of them - the Gifted & Talented program - just happens to be where the school's changelings gather in their own tiny freehold. Will the five teenage Kithain manage to pull off a true miracle and save their program? Or will they be betrayed by those they trust?

Included in this product is:

Five fully fleshed out changeling characters, each with a detailed sheet, biography, goals, and secrets. Play as the track-star Satyr, the popular Sidhe, the bad boy Troll, the artistic but tortured Sluagh, or the car nerd Nocker.
A reference sheet for the benefit of new players, detailing what each character is capable of.
A Storyteller's Guide, featuring the main plot, important story characters, and advice on how to run this chronicle sandbox-style.


Save the Gifted & Talented program!

boardgame.name: A Deal With Darkness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forget the cloistered sorcerer, dabbling with the elements in his private sanctum. Forget the alchemist, dabbling with pseudoscientific baubles in a messy laboratory. Forget the blood-witch, drawing on the dwindling lifeforce of her victims.

The true path to power comes from calling upon the essence of the unknown.

A Deal With Darkness contains:
• Updated Pact systems for second edition Chronicles of Darkness games
• Merits and Powers for Vampire, Werewolf, Mage, Changeling, Beast, and Demon, for summoning, pact-seeking, and empowering pacts themselves.
• Rules for various forms of pact-sealing entities, ranging from ghosts and spirits to supernal entities to the gentry and more.
• Advice and optional rules for altering the systems and tuning them for your Chronicles

boardgame.name: Accursed Heirs: Dhampirs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Accursed Heirs: Dhampirs is a sourcebook for V20 building upon the rules presented in Time of Thin Blood and Beckett's Jyhad Diary that expands the role of half-vampires in the World of Darkness.

Children of the Dead

Born half-shrouded in night, dhampirs shook the foundations of Kindred Society with their first infant cries. Now a new generation of demi-vampires stands in the shadow of the Ivory Tower and the fatal arc of the Sword of Caine. Some look upon the nighttime world with covetous eyes, while others burn with the promise of retribution.

Reapers of the Damned

Something stirs from the long-forgotten past. The blood of Caine thickens and settles in the Last Generations, whispering of times more ancient when other half-vampires walked the Earth as God’s punishment upon the Undead...

Accursed Heirs includes:

Revised and expanded rules for creating half-vampire characters, from those who serve the Kindred to those who hunt them.
Setting updates that bring dhampirs into the Modern Nights.
Guidelines for dhampirs predating the modern era, and those born of potent blood.
Advice for half-vampire chronicles, including stories where the Kindred acknowledge and cultivate their mortal children.
New rules for dhampirs – including 7 character types, 4 new Backgrounds, over 30 Merits & Flaws relevant to dhampirs, and over 20 Bloodrights: powers unique to half-vampires

boardgame.name: Eternals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the story of the greatest heroes Creation has ever forgotten. The Eternal Exalted gave everything to save humanity from the Primordials’ tyranny: their lives, their twin Incarnae, their celestial icon, and when their labors were finished their only reward was to be put to rest and forgotten. For three ages of man they have slumbered, awaiting a time when humanity called once more for heroes of virtue. That time is now. If you would answer that call, open this book and begin your quest, for the world will not wait to be saved.

A character sourcebook for Exalted® featuring:
• Everything players and Storytellers need to generate Eternal Exalted characters, including their Charms
• The complete history of the Twin Incarna, the gods of life and death, including the tragic origin and fall of their Chosen
• Rules for soul-sharing Truths, a magic unique to the Eternal Exalted that allows them to combine the best traits of several heroes together to create more perfect champions

boardgame.name: Echoes of the Past
boardgame.description:
from the overview:
This adventure is an introduction to the Secret of Zir’An Role-Playing Game. It contains a quickstart rules guide and a short scenario complete with sample characters that should last a few hours for two to five players and a Hand of Fate (the storyteller or game master). Moderately experienced gamers familiar with RPGs will find this adventure a mix of action-packed roleplaying, exploration and combat, suited to the abilities of the Adventurers provided.

boardgame.name: The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts 6: Lunars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creation is filled with more strange creatures than any man could ever hope to catalogue in a single lifetime. For better or for worse, the author of The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts may not die until he has catalogued them all.

We return with the sixth installment in our series of bestiaries for Exalted Third Edition. The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts is a game-focused guide to creatures, with the primary aim of making it easy for Storytellers to construct encounters (or for players to summon). Remember how we used to have the Monster Manual? Yeah! Like that!

In this book, we present stat blocks for nine Lunar Exalted of many different areas of specialization, along with a set of fourteen animal form cards that make it easy to swap shapes on the go. This modular design makes it simple to customize these QCs to meet your needs and design encounters that will challenge your players. I've also included a section of Storyteller advice to make sure you know how to do so!

The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts: aiming to present you with all the NPC stats you need to enjoy Exalted without having to break any pencils or weep because your players destroyed all opposition in one turn again, since 2018.

boardgame.name: Secret Sorrow of the Siblings
兄妹秘哀 ～イヤなのに、カンじちゃう～
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Kaito is a a bit inferior to his intelligent and athletic twin brother Rikuto, and by an accident discover their younger sister Arisa fellating Rikuto. This brings a bigger hatred towards his brother - as well as his sister; so while Rikuto is busy with a baseball tournament, Kaito is going to use the photo evidence of Rikuto and Arisa to get his revenge...

boardgame.name: The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts 4: Solars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creation is filled with more strange creatures than any man could ever hope to catalogue in a single lifetime. For better or for worse, the author of The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts may not die until he has catalogued them all.

We return with the fourth installment in our series of bestiaries for Exalted Third Edition. The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts is a game-focused guide to creatures, with the primary aim of making it easy for Storytellers to construct encounters (or for players to summon). Remember how we used to have the Monster Manual? Yeah! Like that!

This installment focuses on the Solar Exalted, and presents nine Solar templates that you can apply to whatever Lawgiver in your story suddenly needs to appear in a fight. Each is set up to be usable on their own, but can be combined into a larger encounter with each other or with other kinds of backup. And this book has instructions on exactly how to do that! If you need to fight a Solar, just grab one of these sets of stats and go.

The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts: aiming to present you with all the NPC stats you need to enjoy Exalted without having to break any pencils or weep because your players destroyed all opposition in one turn again, since 2018.

boardgame.name: The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts 2: Elementals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creation is filled with more strange creatures than any man could ever hope to catalogue in a single lifetime. For better or for worse, the author of The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts may not die until he has catalogued them all.

We return with the second installment in our series of bestiaries for Exalted Third Edition. The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts is a game-focused guide to creatures, with the primary aim of making it easy for Storytellers to construct encounters (or for players to summon). Remember how we used to have the Monster Manual? Yeah! Like that!

In this book, we present thirteen new elementals, each of them designed to be used by players who long to increase their roster of summoned spirits. Do you need a bodyguard who can move a mountain, but can't reliably carry a bundle of firewood across the yard? Are you prepared to put your well-being in the hands of a man with apples growing in his hair? Do you want to enter into a business arrangement with a giant shark? If so, you're in the right place. This book contains bodyguards, muscle, spies, herbalists, poisoners, majordomos, and a dinosaur.

But wait! Was that somehow not enough? Because I also threw in some new shaping rituals and plenty of reskins! You don't like my handsome balloon-man? It requires only a few tweaks to turn him into a deadly dragon-mantis! (Balloon men and mantises share 99% of their DNA.)

The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts: aiming to present you with all the NPC stats you need to enjoy Exalted without having to break any pencils or weep because your players destroyed all opposition in one turn again, since 2018.

boardgame.name: The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts 1: Martial Artists
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creation is filled with more strange creatures than any man could ever hope to catalogue in a single lifetime. For better or for worse, the author of The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts may not die until he has catalogued them all.

This is the first installment in a series of bestiaries for Exalted Third Edition. The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts is a game-focused guide to creatures, with the primary aim of making it easy for Storytellers to construct encounters (or for players to summon). Remember how we used to have the Monster Manual? Yeah! Like that!

This installment of The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts focuses on martial artists. It features an array of mortal martial artists of varying skill levels as well as a few Exalted boss monsters. Each can be customized with a variety of different martial arts styles. With these, you can construct an entertaining encounter for Exalts of every power level, from Air Aspects who mostly bought dots in Bureaucracy to Solars eager to resurrect the "Dawn hydra."

With entirely-original art created by Kirsten Moody, The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts aims at being the high-quality book of encounters you've been vaguely expecting to start existing for years.

boardgame.name: The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts 3: Sorcerers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creation is filled with more strange creatures than any man could ever hope to catalogue in a single lifetime. For better or for worse, the author of The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts may not die until he has catalogued them all.

This is the third installment in a series of bestiaries for Exalted Third Edition. The Thousand Sanctioned Beasts is a game-focused guide to creatures, with the primary aim of making it easy for Storytellers to construct encounters (or for players to summon). Remember how we used to have the Monster Manual? Yeah! Like that!

This entry in the ongoing bestiary is focused on sorcerers. These wielders of strange magic may not be Exalted, but they have powers of their own. The first of these powers is knowledge. This second of these powers is power. Sometimes power comes in the form of a small army of blood apes. Other times it comes in the ability to drink souls as wine! Power is surprisingly fungible, like money.

Use these stats to toss a slightly off-beat encounter at your players. This book includes stats for four separate builds of sorcerer, plus thirteen new spells and a bonus shaping ritual.

boardgame.name: Dungeon of Corruption
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Read the movements of the two apostles to try to catch them using traps.

The apostles are Griselda who is the Apostle of Darkness and Eliska the Apostle of Light.

boardgame.name: Legacy: Nightwalker Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mages on the Acanthus path draw their power from the Realm of Arcadia. As such, they take on many qualities associated with fey creatures such as odd, unpredictable behavior, wanderlust, and a certain immaturity. These traits are drawn from the fey of the Seelie court, who celebrate Summer, life, joy, and creativity. For most Acanthus mages, this is a perfect fit. The Nightwalkers, however, feel the pull of a darker path.

Mages of this Legacy feel a kinship with the darker spirits of the fey realms. Unseelie faeries, the celebration of Winter, and a certain peace with death, dying and decay mark the mages who join the Nightwalkers. These mages embrace the underbelly of Arcadia, looking to the Unseelie courts for inspiration and drawing upon decay and entropy to guide their quests and journeys.

Step onto the Path

Claim your Legacy!

Legacy: Nightwalker Second Edition offers a new Acanthus Legacy for use in your Mage: The Awakening Second Edition game!

boardgame.name: 100 Wendigo Kinfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the world was young, the place now called America had three tribes of garou; the Uktena, the Croatan, and the Wendigo. Elder Brother, Middle Brother, and Younger Brother respectively. While they had their conflicts and fights, nothing prepared them for the strife and bloodshed that came with the colonizers, and the tribes they call the Wyrmbringers. While the Croatan are dead, and the Uktena have adapted, the Wendigo endure with the quiet, cold wrath of a winter storm in the high mountains.

Suspicious of outsiders, and quick to rely on their teeth, the Wendigo resist the changes being pushed onto them. Their kin are warriors, yes, but while many are still fighting the same fight they’ve been in for centuries, others are using the tools of law and treaties, as well as the potent weapon of revitalizing their own culture, to stand tall in a new age. From tribal leaders and politicians, to lawyers, firefighters, artists, and historians, the tribe’s kin have been on this land longer than anyone else. They remember, and they will not be moved.

boardgame.name: Werewolf the Savage Age Vol. 2: Rise of the Garou
Werewolf the Savage Age Volume 2: The Rise of the Garou
Werewolf the Savage Age Volume Two: The Rise of the Garou
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore How The Garou Became a Nation

There was a time many, many centuries ago when 'Garou' and the 'Garou Nation' were radical and unproven concepts. With this Savage Age book you will explore the Fera who came together to form the Garou Nation... and laid the framework for the modern Garou Tribes.

Savage Age Volume 2 continues Volume 1's exploration of the War of Rage and how that crucible created the conditions for the creation of the Garou.

The ancient canid-shifters known as the Bilai, Atzu Telal Nahau, and Siberakh came together in an alliance born of necessity. Along with them came the Gurahl known as the Saksom Aknami - the Stone Eaters - and the jackal-shifters known as the Anupu-Ba-El. These were the Nation's founders. Not all would survive the War of Rage.

It is time to tell their stories from their perspective.

The Rise of the Garou

The Savage Age Vol: 2 Features:

Character-focused rules and setting background for playing in the War of Rage.
An in-depth discussion of the factions that were the proto-Garou. New mechanics, including in-theme Gifts.
New and Expanded totems.
Over 20 pieces of new original art throughout the book.
Legends of the Fera
Extensive advice for playing in the dawn of civilization, including a essays on being lupus in the Savage Age as well as the state of technology.
Writers' and editor's notes that discusses design decisions.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Werewolf the Savage Age Volume Two: The Rise of the Garou PDF

boardgame.name: Cult of the Green Skull
boardgame.description:
For 4 to 6 Player Characters, Level 1

From the introduction:

Rumors of a cult in the region have been around for a number of years, but few took the rumors seriously. However, with two children recently having gone missing and a strange unholy symbol bearing the image of a green skull appearing all over the village, the locals no longer believe the cult to be a mere rumor.

boardgame.name: Sword Maiden of Azure Dragon
boardgame.description:
User Summary

RPG set in a magical world. It consists of eight chapters full of quests and side quests - both of a traditional and sexual content!

The heroine of the story is a spirited bisexual dragonborn princess, and ogether with her allies she tried to defeat the ultimate evil using her sword, her wits - and her body.

The game offers many chances to satisfy her lust with a wide selection of women, but it's up to the player to decide what will happen.

boardgame.name: The Secret of Zir'an Fate Screen
boardgame.description:
user summary:
A game screen for use by the Hand of Fate (game master). Also includes the Empyriar Code Wheel for translating Empyriar to English.

The screen features information for: the Zir'An calendar, combat actions & effects, weather, average NPC stats, and armor values for objects and armor

The screen is medium cardstock printed in black-and-white with gloss foils on the exterior. It is 33 inches wide by 8.5 inches high and scored to fold into three letter-size sections. The code wheel is a separate letter-size sheet with instructions on cutting it out and assembling it.

boardgame.name: Pirates & Lasers
boardgame.description:
Pirates & Lasers is a strategic struggle between ghost pirates and incompetent laser-wielding tourists. Keep the ship sailing as long as you can while lasers tear your ship asunder, managing resources and preventing damage to critical areas.

This turn-based strategy game challenges players to survive laser attacks and repair the boat hull each turn to prevent sinking.

Ship Blinks, which have health and the ability to transfer health to any neighboring Ship Blink, and Hazard Blinks, which fire lasers out in three directions, damaging any part of the Ship in its path. A turn has three stages - Rearrange, Repair, and Lasers! During Rearrange, Ship and Hazard Blinks are moved to prevent damage. During Repair, resources can be moved from one part of the Ship to another. During Lasers!, the Hazard Blinks fire off their lasers, dealing damage to any part of the Ship in its path. The game ends when any part of the Ship hits zero health. See how many turns you can survive in a given scenario!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2
boardgame.description: remake
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Remake / Remaster of the Year Nominee
2020 Gamescom Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2020 Global Game Awards Best Remaster of the Year Nominee
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Game Revival of the Year Nominee
2020 The Game Awards Best Sports/Racing Game of the Year Winner
2021 D.I.C.E. Best Sports Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Enigma of the Rotating Rooms
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The main idea of this dungeon is to be part maze, part puzzle. It is composed of a few static rooms on the outer edge,
with 8 rotating panels encircling a non-rotating central chamber.

User summary:

The item presents a map with a series of complex rotating arrangements. It is intended the game master will flesh out the dungeon adventure.

boardgame.name: Many Names of Odin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who is Odin? He's a multifacted god with many names. This is the second in the continuing line of supplements presenting new aspects of the various Pantheons. We are starting with the Aesir.

This Product includes:

New Alternative Virtues for the Aesir
Descriptions, Callings, and Purviews for four versions of Odin, by his many names
New adjustments to backgrounds based on aspect
4 new knacks
4 ready-made characters
Wellspring, Ontario a Terra Incognita

boardgame.name: The Muses of the Theoi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'The Muses of the Theoi is an exciting new supplement, adding nine new divine parents to choose from! These patron goddesses of the arts and sciences are now available for your Scion campaigns! In this exciting new supplement, learn about the nine daughters of Zeus and the Titan Mnemosyne and their place in The World!

This supplement includes:

Nine additional divine patrons from the Theoi Pantheon for Scions: Calliope, Clio, Erato, Euterpe, Melpomene, Polyhymnia, Terpsichore, Thalia, and Urania.
Nine new Birthrights
Three new Strange Places to explore and find

boardgame.name: 1,000 Rooms of Madness
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Crucible Special Supplement

From the introduction:

1,000 rooms of madness. A highly eccentric miscellany of utterly random ideas for dungeon locales.

User summary:

A very large random table. This item does not contain any system mechanics.

boardgame.name: Vengeful Daughters: The Furies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vengeful Daughters: The Furies is an exciting new supplement, adding three new divine parents to choose from, making these warrior goddesses available for your Scion campaign! In this exciting new supplement, learn about The Furies, their motivations, and their place in The World!

This supplement includes:

Three additional divine patrons from the Theoi Pantheon for Scions: Alecto, Megaera, and Tisiphone
Six new Birthrights

boardgame.name: Pizza Delivery
boardgame.description:
In Pizza Delivery, you are a pizza delivery courier, and you must try to make the most profit out of one delivery day, both by delivering pizzas and by fulfilling your secret objectives. You can also use money to buy extra equipment if you think that will help you in the long run.

Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mantles of Washington
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mantles of Washington explores the real-world divine mantles of George Washington, the Founding Father of the United States of America, and makes them available for your Scion campaigns! In this detailed supplement, learn about the divine mantles of the First President, discover a new America-focused religion, and much more.

This product includes:

Three mantles of George Washington (Kami, Orenda, and Theoi) worshiped in our world and mechanically imported for Scion play along with one additional mantle developed specifically for Scion
A new religion, the American Civic Religion, to add flavor to your campaigns
A slew of birthrights related to the First President for Scions to use in their journeys
A new Calling, Revolutionary, with ten new knacks to enhance play

boardgame.name: Philadelphia and the Gods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Philadelphia! Plagued by a curse and the first home of the American Theoi, Philly is a vibrant city filled with Scions, Oracles, monsters and everything in between.

Philadelphia and the Gods is an exploration of one vision of Philadelphia, one where the mythical history of the founding of the United States has wound around more ancient legends. This book includes:

The mythic history of Philadelphia, its founding, and the curse that cracked the Liberty Bell.
The Pythian Congress, the democratic organization of Scions that protects the city from the Curse and all other threats.
A collection of threats to the Congress and the city
Rules for pick-up, troupe-style play in the Scion setting, including Deed rules revised for the play style.
An adventure generator to keep strange things moving in Philadelphia.

boardgame.name: The Republican Pantheon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mortal understanding of the Gods changes over time. The Theoi wore different faces in Greece, in Rome, during the Renaissance...and in America. Meet the faces of the American Theoi, a pantheon dedicated to the preservation of the Republic.

The Republican Pantheon an exploration of the faces of the Theoi associated with Enlightenment neoclassicism and the American Revolution. It includes:

The history of the Republican Compact, the Revolutionary-era deal which forged the new mantles of an entire pantheon.
How the Republican gods are honored in America, including the mysterious Cult of Liber.
The faces of the Republican gods, including a half-dozen new Theoi drawn from Greek and Roman history.
The Cosmology of Republican America
New Birthrights
A foe out of the past: the Divus Julius!


This book stands on its own, but is meant as a companion piece to Philadelphia and the Gods.

boardgame.name: The Pythian Congress
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Philadelphia has a lot of Scions. The Pythian Congress is the group that keeps them from stepping on each others' toes and coordinates their activities.

The Pythian Congress is a collection of 10 characters that will let you start your own Pythian Congress in a game based in Philadelphia and the Gods, or anywhere else there where Scions gather in great numbers.

Note: One character is a Scion of Liber. Basic notes on Liber are included, but more detailed information is available in The Republican Pantheon.

boardgame.name: Guide to Cryptids of South America
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alex, Aoife, Raven, and Sam are back! In the follow-up to Guide to Cryptids of North America , the band of Scions travels the continent of South America as they discover a dozen more strange creatures of The World. The book includes a dozen new antagonists for Origin and Heroic tiers!

boardgame.name: The Enondeara, the Gods of the Tupi-Guarani
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They oppressed their followers, they destroyed their homes, they tried to change their beliefs, but they are still here. The Enondeara, the gods of the Tupi-Guarani are the gods of many Native communities in Brazilian and neighboring countries, and like anything in those lands, they aren't anymore what they once were.

Living in between a cacophony of myths, the Heroes of the Enondeara need to fight to find their place in the World and their myths, as well as battling the monsters and dangers that come from the jungles, as well as those who threaten the jungles.

This book, the Enondeara, the gods of the Tupi-Guarani, brings to the World of Scion a unique pantheon, fragmented yet still fighting, as well as understandings of their cosmology, some possible partners and treasures that their Heroes can find, and some of the enemies they might find lurking around in the lands of Pindorama. Inside of it, you will find.

The Enondeara pantheon, with 14 gods, cosmology and unique Pantheon-Purview.
12 unique Birthrights that the Heroes of this land can have.
3 Antagonists ready to face your Heroes.


What are you waiting for? Come and take a look. But pay attention, you don't want to get lost in the jungle.

boardgame.name: Supernatural Path: Vigilante
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of being born with great and mythical power? Think the current super natural selection can be very narrative changing for more secretive games? Try this new Vigilante Supernatural Path and play as someone who had to earn their powers!

boardgame.name: Beyond the Legend: Mysteries of Olympus
boardgame.description:
Get on a journey to the ancient Greece and relieve a beautiful tale of romance in this exciting Hidden Object Adventure. Theron, a modest hunter deeply in love with the goddess Artemis, has to overcome all obstacles standing on their way to happiness. Travel with Theron across the worlds of mighty gods to finally reach Mount Olympus and to prove that he deserves to be with the goddess. Explore gorgeous locations and watch as amazing and breathtaking story unfolds!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Le drame de la rue des récollets
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ernest was a normal vampire. Can there be anything more pitiable in the world?

Conflated among thousands of other vampires, he wandered under the inevitable, uncertain stars, and the gaze of the bored moon.

boardgame.name: Atlantic Journey: The Lost Brother
boardgame.description:
Go on an amazing global search with Mia and her scholarly uncle in Atlantic Journey: The Lost Brother! Travel across different continents and solve the mystery behind Mia’s brother’s disappearance. Team up with Mia’s uncle and follow in Jack’s footsteps to discover a secret that could save all of humanity! Explore gorgeous scenes and solve clever puzzles in Atlantic Journey: The Lost Brother and save the day!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: La malédiction de l'Ile de Sein
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

December 6, 1796. The Kergasoil couple was on board a ship nearing the port of Brest, though in heavy, foggy weather. The ship's captain saw a winking light which he mistook for a navigational aid marking the boundary of the island reef. He discovered too late, however, that the purpose of the light was not to be helpful...

boardgame.name: ダーリン・イン・ザ・フランキスXX Darling in the Franxx
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Far in Earth’s prehistoric history, millions of years before human civilization rose to prominence, Earth was inhabited by a species known as Klaxo sapiens. They were a humanoid race with horns and blue skin, and possessed a technology base much more advanced than that of humanity. They were a peaceful species though, and they lived in harmony with nature as they advanced their society, but their whole world was thrown into disarray when they were invaded by an alien race.

boardgame.name: Amulet of Time: Shadow of la Rochelle
boardgame.description:
When the ghost of the beautiful Diane de Poitiers appears in front of you, you are transported back in time in Amulet of Time: Shadow of la Rochelle! Explore France and an incredible love story in this amazing Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. Uncover a conspiracy against the king's mistress and protect her to return to the present. Live through an incredible tale in Amulet of Time: Shadow of la Rochelle!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Critical Mediocrity Deck (SF)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Critical Mediocrity deck, the ultimate tool for severe averageness.

What the heck is Critical Mediocrity?!

This deck is specifically designed to introduce some randomness and rare, interesting events to a campaign, without being as extreme or punishing as critical hit and critical fumble options. So the impact of the critical mediocrity deck is felt more often but represents the kind of minor give-and-take common in combat rather than examples of the very best and very worst things that can happen. This has the advantage of shaking things up with unusual and unexpected events without everyone cringing and preparing for the entire combat to take a sudden turn when a card is drawn. The idea is to shake things up a little and add some flavor and interesting opportunities, rather than inject wild swings of radical results.

User summary:

A print-and-play card deck, with instructions and suggestions for use.

boardgame.name: Critical Mediocrity Deck (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The idea is to shake things up a little and add some flavor and interesting opportunities, rather than inject wild swings of radical results.

User summary:

A print-and-play card deck, with instructions and suggestions for use.

boardgame.name: The Magician's Handbook II: BlackLore
boardgame.description:
Return to a world of magic and mystery where the enchanted Magician's Handbook will be your guide. The evil magician pirate BlackLore has captured all the world's magicians and fairies. Using their magic to fly his pirate ship, he's terrorized all who tried to get in his way...and you're next on his list!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ferien-Rallye
Ferien-Rallye
Ferien-Rallye
Ferien-Rallye
Ferien-Rallye
boardgame.description:
Each player moves his car by roll of a die on a map of the Weserbergland, a region in Northern Germany. Each player starts at Hannover and draws 3 destination cards. When a player arrives at one of his destinations, he must stop, discards his card and draws an event card. The player who first stopped at all 3 destinations and returned to Hannover wins the game.
This game is part of a serie concerning several regions.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Count of Monte Cristo
Der Graf von Monte Christo
boardgame.description:
Edmond Dantes a dashing young captain has been betrayed by enemies who called themselves friends and is wrongly imprisoned. Many years have passed, then one day a monk and scholar enters his prison cell through an escape tunnel.

They become fast friends and then Edmond finally escapes his lifelong prison. Help him find his offenders and get revenge once and for all. Find the cleverly hidden objects and solve the unique puzzles!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Pit
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a far away land, where the dying sun holds vigil at the end of the world, there is a broad, black desert of dead things and a City.

The City's name is Seal, a line of fire against the horizon. Nobody knows who built it, or when it came to be. It is built around the edge of another city, enveloping its rim in a great, burning ring.

boardgame.name: KAOS
boardgame.description:
KAOS is a battle game where two sides of twenty fighters will have to defeat each other in order for the wish of their God Etharyl to be fulfilled. In KAOS each player represents an Etharyl, who will declare a wish before battle.

The player (an Etharyl God), before combat, can make sacrifices in his own team to resurrect fighters or make them more powerful, managing his team in order to avoid running out fighters. Also, the player can erase skills from rival fighters by exhausting glint points, in a limited way. During combat between fighters, destiny will decide.

The game is finished when an Etharyl runs out of fighters. At this moment, it must accept the wish of the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Small Trifle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jeny Greenteeth again needs the help of adventurers, and this time, she is willing to pay a large price for their help – restoring the pact between Phlan and the fey of the Quivering Forest. All she needs is a coin from a dragon hoard. Easy enough, right?

A Four/Six-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: Shadows of Rith Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 1 Border Kingdoms Adventure:

The ruins of Rith Keep lie a short distance from the small Border Kingdoms thorp of Largrin. In times past, the keep was home to the self-appointed River Lord of Largrin, a warrior of great skill who protected the surrounding lands. It is now little more than a stone shell, which rumors say is haunted. Are these tales simply the fanciful stories of local beet farmers, or does something more sinister lurk in the shadows of Rith Keep?

boardgame.name: The Folly of Sneaky Simon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 1 Border Kingdoms Adventure

The council of merchant dukes from the town of Emrys have recently been troubled by a highwayman outside of the city spooking off would be merchants and customers alike. Whispers speak of a tiny demon in a red hat with knives faster than sound, but what is the real truth?

boardgame.name: Framed in Felshroun
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 1 Border Kingdoms Adventure

As the heroes are celebrating vanquishing a cursed spirit in Felshroun, they find out it’s not as dead as they’d hoped. A frantic chase through the city ensues. Can the heroes banish it for good before too much damage is done?

boardgame.name: Wicked Little Things
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 1 Border Kingdoms Adventure

Lord Barlett is at the end of his wit trying to keep his Manor together. Doors slamming, objects disappearing, harm upon the Manor children and more have plagued the estate for far too long. Can the adventurers determine the cause of these events?

boardgame.name: In the Dead of Knight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 2 Border Kingdoms Adventure

When a young prince’s parents are kidnapped, it is the characters who answer the call for help. Can they learn the hidden truth before it's too late or will they join countless other unfortunate souls, forgotten and dead in fetid swamp waters?

boardgame.name: Breath of Fire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 3 Border Kingdoms Adventure

One of the merchant princes of the Border Kingdoms has a truly heroic quest for you. Reports from the south talk of a fire breathing beast that is causing problems with the caravans along the roads. The task is more than to just slay the beast – this merchant is looking to make use of an artifact that came into his possession. He wants you to capture it with the artifact and return it to him, to use for the betterment of the entire Border Kingdoms. Are you up to the task?

boardgame.name: Soulbound Podręcznik Podstawowy
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound
boardgame.description:
Explore the Mortal Realms in the first ever tabletop roleplaying game set in the world of Warhammer Age of Sigmar! You are Soulbound: heroes chosen by the gods to stand against the horrors that plague the Mortal Realms, tasked with preventing a new age of Chaos, Death, and Destruction. Forge your group from some of the most powerful heroes in the realms and face down roving bands of cannibals, legions of undead, and hordes of daemons in a desperate struggle for survival.

Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound contains 13 thrilling chapters to sink your teeth into, including:

Archetypes
Skills and Talents
Equipment
Between Adventures
The Mortal Realms
The Great Parch
Religion and Belief
Magic
Bestiary

boardgame.name: Roar and Write!
boardgame.description:
It’s time for the Selection Committee of the Animal Kingdom to choose the new monarch to rule over all. Now it’s up to you to appease the five council members on the Selection Committee to win the Regency. The catch...each Committee member is appeased in a different way, so you must choose wisely as you can only appeal to one each Age.

Roar and Write is a competitive press-your-luck game about impressing different council members on the selection committee, garnering favor throughout the five kingdoms, and completing your own personal objectives to rise to the top of the selection committee's choices for the new ruler of the Animal Kingdoms.

Do you have what it takes to impress the Selection Committee over your opposing candidates?

Roar and Write is played over 5 ages, and in each age a communal pool of 6 dice is rolled three separate times. You’ll select dice in order to make offerings to members of the council and gain favour in the 5 kingdoms, ultimately trying to meet a council member’s unique preferences (such as a certain sum, all 1’s, only odds, etc).

The more selection council members you appease throughout the 5 ages, the more you are rewarded. The sooner you write down your last council offering of the age the better. But don’t forget your own needs too! Fulfilling your own personal agenda will boost your score as well.

At the end of the 5th Age, your personal agenda is revealed, scores are tallied, and the new Monarch is revealed!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 39 - Roar and Write!, Bandada, & Big Easy Busking

Deep Dive expansion also available.

boardgame.name: Tattered Tales
boardgame.description:
Tattered Tales is a game that requires players to compete as teams to create stories using a collection of random items to solve a problem.

To play a round, players will split into teams and each team is dealt five item cards. A single situation card is revealed for all teams. Players have two minutes to work together in teams to create a story that uses the items to resolve the situation.

Once the time is up, teams take turns telling their stories to the rest of the players. Everybody votes on which story they liked the best (besides their own) and a new round begins with new teams.

After a few rounds, final scoring is calculated and a single player is given the title of Master Storyteller.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Once and Future Cuisine
boardgame.description:
It’s the Time Tyrant’s wedding and they’ve called on you to whip up the feast! The Tyrant knows a chef is only
as good as their ingredients and has loaned you a time machine to let you leap through the ages and collect delicacies that will truly wow the guests.

Each round has three phases: 1) travel in time, 2) claim ingredients, 3) cleanup. Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, each player on their turn places a pawn on an era board, representing their claim on an ingredient from that era. Then, after everyone has placed their pawns, all chefs collect their ingredients, and the era boards are refilled.

Chefs are looking to show off their skills by featuring either a course of the same dish type (drink, appetizer, entree, or dessert) but of different eras known as a "Dish Set", or showcase the foods of one era known as an "Era Set".

The game ends immediately when either of the following happens during the “refill” step of the round’s Cleanup phase: either 3 or more era boards have all their cuisine spots filled with cards from eras other than their own (Paradoxes Aplenty), or it is not possible to fill all the cuisine spots on 1 or more era boards (Continuity Error). The chef with the tastiest tableau is the winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Legendary Box
boardgame.description: The Legendary Box contains all stretch goals from the initial Kickstarter campaign for Arena: The Contest (Imperial Box) as well as all expansions from the first campaign (Heroes & Dungeons, Harun the Shapeshifter, Hydra, Ascaran the Archangel & Vanarus the Demon, and The Elder Dragon).
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Arena: The Contest – Harun the Shapeshifter
Arena: The Contest – Hydra, Ascaran the Archangel & Vanarus the Demon
Arena: The Contest – The Elder Dragon

boardgame.name: Good Luck You're On Your Own (Issue 1 - May 2020)
boardgame.description:
Good Luck You're On Your Own
Issue 1
boardgame.rpgissue: Good Luck You're On Your Own

boardgame.name: Good Luck You're On Your Own (Issue 2 - May 2020)
boardgame.description:
Good Luck You're On Your Own
Issue 2
boardgame.rpgissue: Good Luck You're On Your Own

boardgame.name: Canvas: Kickstarter Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter exclusive that includes 10 art cards and 8 award cards (plus a rules cards).

The art cards in the mini expansion feature two new icons that are not in the base game. The bonus ribbon gives you straight victory points, but doesn't help you meet any scoring conditions. The x2 icon doubles the icon in the slot that it points to.

Each game you can play with a different Award card that has a unique game end scoring rule. These cards add variability and complexity to make the game more replayable, especially at expert levels.

listing.notes: This is a brandnew, sealed copy. Latest 2022 edition. Fresh from Kickstarter. USA shipping $5. Can combine shipping for multiple games. . 1 lbs 8x6x1 inch
This is the expansion to the game. It includes 8 goal cards and 10 acrylic paint cards. Shipping is $8 to US only. I will combine shipping with other game purchases.

boardgame.name: Tlamatini
boardgame.description: A trivia game about Mexico. The board consists of a map of Mexico, with a route leading from the Northwest to the Southeast. The active player rolls a d6 which determines a trivia category, then has to answer a question in that category. If successful, they move forward; if wrong, others get a chance to answer the question. Movement range is decided by whether additional clues were used. Some fields also have special functions. The first player to arrive at the end of the route is the winner.

boardgame.name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Czwarty
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty Dżentelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

Episode 4 consists of 220 new cards:
50 new Black Cards of questions
155 new White Cards of answers
15 blank cards (5 black, 10 white) for Your ideas.
This game is fully compatible with previous editions

—user summary

Oto długo wyczekiwany Epizod Czwarty!
Pocałuj prababcię w czoło i wyłącz aparaturę podtrzymującą życie! :)
Pudełko zawiera 220 kart w tym:
50 nowych Czarnych Kart pytań
155 nowych Białych Kart odpowiedzi

boardgame.name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Trzeci
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty Dżentelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

Episode 3 consists of 220 new cards:

72 brand new cards (17 black i 55 white).

Epizod Trzeci składa się z 220 kart, a w tym 148 kart z rozszerzeń:
